revision.text:
{{Infobox scientist | name = Albert Einstein | birth_date = {{birth date|1879|3|14}} | birth_place = [[Ulm]], [[German Empire]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1955|4|18|1879|3|14}} | death_place = [[Princeton, New Jersey]], U.S. | field = [[Physics]] | alma_mater = [[ETH Zurich]] | known_for = [[General relativity]], [[Special relativity]], [[Photoelectric effect]] }}
'''Albert Einstein''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|aɪ|n|s|t|aɪ|n}} {{respell|EYEN|styne}}; German: [ˈalbɛʁt ˈʔaɪnʃtaɪn]; 14 March 1879 – 18 April 1955) was a German-born theoretical [[physicist]] who is widely held to be one of the greatest and most influential scientists of all time.
Einstein is best known for developing the [[theory of relativity]], but he also made important contributions to the development of the theory of [[quantum mechanics]]. Relativity and quantum mechanics are the two pillars of [[modern physics]]. His mass–energy equivalence formula ''E'' = ''mc''<sup>2</sup>, which arises from relativity theory, has been dubbed "the world's most famous equation".
== Early life == Einstein was born in [[Ulm]], in the [[Kingdom of Württemberg]] in the [[German Empire]], on 14 March 1879. His parents were [[Hermann Einstein]], a salesman and engineer, and Pauline Koch.
== Career == Einstein received the 1921 [[Nobel Prize in Physics]] "for his services to Theoretical Physics, and especially for his discovery of the law of the [[photoelectric effect]]".
[[Category:1879 births]] [[Category:1955 deaths]] [[Category:German physicists]] [[Category:Nobel laureates in Physics]] [[Category:People from Ulm]]

{{Infobox settlement | name = Tokyo | native_name = 東京 | settlement_type = [[Metropolis]] | image_skyline = Tokyo_Montage_2015.jpg | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{flagicon|JPN}} [[Japan]] | population_total = 13960000 | area_total_km2 = 2194 | coordinates = {{coord|35|41|N|139|41|E|display=inline,title}} }}
'''Tokyo''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|t|oʊ|k|i|oʊ}}; Japanese: 東京, Tōkyō) is the capital and most populous [[prefecture]] of [[Japan]]. Located at the head of [[Tokyo Bay]], the prefecture forms part of the [[Kantō region]] on the central Pacific coast of Japan's main island, [[Honshu]].
Tokyo is the political and economic center of the country, as well as the seat of the [[Emperor of Japan]] and the national government. The [[Greater Tokyo Area]] is the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
== History == The area that is now Tokyo was inhabited by several tribes. In 1603, [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]] established the [[Tokugawa shogunate]] and made Edo (later Tokyo) its capital.
[[Category:Tokyo]] [[Category:Capitals in Asia]] [[Category:Cities in Japan]] [[Category:Populated places in Tokyo]]
This is a talk page discussion about the Albert Einstein article.

{{Infobox company | name = Microsoft Corporation | logo = Microsoft_logo.svg | type = [[Public company|Public]] | traded_as = {{nasdaq|MSFT}} | industry = [[Technology]] | founded = {{start date and age|1975|04|04}} | founders = [[Bill Gates]], [[Paul Allen]] | headquarters = [[Redmond, Washington]], U.S. | key_people = [[Satya Nadella]] (CEO) | products = [[Windows]], [[Microsoft 365]], [[Azure]] }}
'''Microsoft Corporation''' is an American multinational [[technology company|technology corporation]] headquartered in [[Redmond, Washington]]. Microsoft's best-known software products are the [[Windows]] line of [[operating systems]], the [[Microsoft 365]] suite of productivity applications, and the [[Internet Explorer]] and [[Microsoft Edge|Edge]] [[web browser]]s.
== History == Microsoft was founded by [[Bill Gates]] and [[Paul Allen]] on April 4, 1975, to develop and sell [[BASIC]] interpreters for the [[Altair 8800]].
[[Category:Microsoft]] [[Category:Companies based in Washington (state)]] [[Category:Technology companies of the United States]] [[Category:American companies established in 1975]]

{{Infobox film | name = Inception | image = Inception_poster.jpg | director = [[Christopher Nolan]] | producer = [[Christopher Nolan]], [[Emma Thomas]] | writer = Christopher Nolan | starring = [[Leonardo DiCaprio]], [[Ellen Page]], [[Tom Hardy]] | music = [[Hans Zimmer]] | released = {{film date|2010|07|16}} | runtime = 148 minutes | country = United States, United Kingdom | language = English | budget = $160 million | gross = $836.8 million }}
'''''Inception''''' is a 2010 [[science fiction film|science fiction]] [[action film]] written and directed by [[Christopher Nolan]], who also produced the film with [[Emma Thomas]]. The film stars [[Leonardo DiCaprio]] as a professional thief who steals information by infiltrating the subconscious of his targets.
== Plot == Dom Cobb is a skilled thief, the absolute best in the dangerous art of extraction, stealing valuable secrets from deep within the subconscious during the dream state.
[[Category:2010 films]] [[Category:American science fiction films]] [[Category:Films directed by Christopher Nolan]] [[Category:Films about dreams]]
